title.title: Launch into summer with increased services on the Thames

texts: Londoners and visitors to London will have more opportunities to enjoy the River Thames when the new spring/summer timetable for London River Services comes into effect on Monday 3 April.
Enjoy a leisurely cruise or visit a variety of London landmarks by river
Most services will enjoy increased frequencies, with many operators extending their operating hours or serving additional piers.

Passengers can take a leisurely cruise from Westminster or Embankment to Greenwich, taking in a number of London's most famous tourist attractions, including BA London Eye and the Tower of London, or enjoy a leisurely meal in style on one of our lunch or dinner cruises.
Commuters will also benefit from an increased frequency on Thames Clipper services.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Westminster - Greenwich - Thames Barrier Cruise - in operation from 3 April to 29 October","London Eye - River Cruise Experience - in operation from 1 April to 31 October","Westminster - Kew - Hampton Court - in operation from 10 April to 30 September","Richmond - Kingston - Hampton Court - in operation from 1 April until 30 September"]}
Additional services will be launched later in the season, including the Greenwich Pier Sunday Evening Sightseeing Cruise (28 May).
Full timetable and fare details can be found in London River Services' Spring/Summer 2006 Guide, which is available in all Zone 1 Tube stations and at staffed piers on the Thames.
